title: Trump declares 'energy emergency,' ends fight against climate change in favor of 'drill, baby drill!'
summary: The new US president has put an end to the Biden administration's Green New Deal. The tech sector, for its part, has become a massive energy sink through operating its artificial intelligence centers.

title: World Health Organization destabilized by US withdrawal
summary: Donald Trump's decision will have an even greater impact on the WHO, as the US is the main funder of the UN organization. This situation is likely to complicate many health policies, including the fight against future pandemics.

summary: In his speech, Joe Biden's successor combined a gloomy vision of the country with proactive optimism and sweeping new plans for immigration and the management of the federal government.

title: 'The story of Paris's Philharmonie is typical of a France that grumbles, before letting go'
summary: Much criticized before its construction, the symphony hall has become one of the most successful in the world. In ten years, it has succeeded in attracting a large and diverse audience, writes Le Monde's Michel Guerrin.

title: Why Russia and Iran signed a new 'strategic partnership'
summary: The two countries have been engaged in unprecedented rapprochement since the start of the war in Ukraine, with Moscow seeking to demonstrate that it is not isolated and a weakened Tehran needing Russian support.

title: The kind souls looking after small English country churches
summary: While the reconstruction of Notre-Dame de Paris has been passionately followed across the Channel, the restoration of English and Welsh religious heritage buildings leaves much to be desired. One organization, Friends of Friendless Churches, is doing its bit.

title: Donald Trump's team intends to carry out historic rupture
summary: As he returned to the White House on Monday, January 20, Donald Trump has surrounded himself with a team of loyal followers to implement an agenda dominated by immigration repression, an aggressive trade policy and the undermining of federal and international institutions.

title: Biden issues last-minute pardons for family members
summary: US President Joe Biden issued pre-emptive pardons for medical advisor Anthony Fauci, retired general Mark Milley and committee members and witnesses of the January 6 riots, as well as close family members, to protect those targeted by Donald Trump.

title: The death of Bertrand Blier, French director and screenwriter, who wrote 'Going Places'
summary: A provocative filmmaker who embraced vulgarity, worked with Depardieu and racked up several popular hits including 'Too Beautiful for You,' 'Buffet froid' and ' Get Out Your Handkerchiefs,' he died on Monday, January 20, at 85.

title: With Donald Trump back in the White House, the American press sizes up his initial moves
summary: The 'New York Times' expresses concern over the pardons granted to the rioters who stormed the Capitol in 2021, while the 'Wall Street Journal' feels that democracy may be less at risk 'than many people think.'

title: In Germany, the question of aid to Ukraine enters the election campaign
summary: Running for re-election, Social Democrat Olaf Scholz wants to avoid any military escalation with Russia. In contrast, the Greens – members of his coalition – are calling for greater support for Kyiv's forces. These positions are shared by the conservatives of the CDU-CSU and their leader, Friedrich Merz, who is leading the polls.

title: Rights groups worry Trump move will halt Cuba prisoner release
summary: The Cuban Observatory of Human Rights, based in Spain, in a statement Tuesday expressed 'great concern about the possible cancellation, pause or delay of the release of political prisoners in Cuba.' The Biden administration in its final days had removed Cuba from the US terror list in return for a promise to release 553 people.

title: Trump administration directs all federal diversity, equity and inclusion staff be put on leave

title: As fire-fanning winds continue, Southern California readies for potential rain and toxic runoff
summary: A 60% to 80% chance of a small amount of rain was forecast for Southern California starting Saturday, with most areas likely getting not more than a third of an inch (0.8 cm), according to Ryan Kittell, a meteorologist for the National Weather Service's office for Los Angeles.

title: Victor Wembanyama and the NBA in Paris: 'It's a bit like two worlds colliding'
summary: The French basketball star arrived in the Paris region on Monday with his partners from the San Antonio Spurs for two NBA games, and returned to his old club, Nanterre.

title: Indonesia rescuers search for survivors as landslide kills at least 17
summary: Intense rainfall in a mountainous area near Pekalongan city in Central Java province sparked the landslide on Monday, collapsing bridges and burying cars and houses.
